intro: Calonema radiale, commonly known as the radiate calonema, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant features a compact, low-growing rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white wax. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically during the summer months. Calonema radiale is prized for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil with minimal water.
